task-wr.title: Managing Controller Nodes
task-wr.shortdesc: You can replace controller nodes or disks while the system is running.

context.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade system uses exactly two controllers; you cannot add or remove a controller. However, you can replace the primary or secondary disks, and you can replace faulty controller nodes.

note.p: If you are replacing disks in order to increase the controller storage capacity, follow the instructions for .

info.p: Open the Hosts list by clicking Inventory on the System Panel section of the Admin menu, and then selecting the Hosts tab.
Click More Lock Host for the controller.
Wait for the procedure to be completed.

step.cmd: Power down the standby controller and make any required hardware changes.

info.p: This may involve replacing disks, or replacing the host completely.

step.cmd: Place the new or modified controller into service.

info.p: Wait until the controller is reported as Locked, Enabled, and Available.

substep.cmd: If required, reinstall the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade software on the controller.

info.p: If you are making disk changes to increase storage capacity, you must re-install the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade software. For more information, see .

To reinstall the software on a host , click
More Reinstall .
Wait for the host to be reported as Locked, Disabled, and Online.
Click More Swact Host for the active controller.

stepresult.p: The standby controller becomes the active controller, and the original active controller is placed into standby.

step.cmd: Lock the original active controller (now in standby).

info.p: Open the Hosts list by clicking Inventory on the System Panel section of the Admin menu, and then selecting the Hosts tab.
Click More Lock Host for the controller.
Wait for the procedure to be completed.

step.cmd: Power down the controller and make the same hardware changes.

note.p: The configurations for controller-0 and controller-1, including disk types and sizes, must be identical.

step.cmd: Power up the new or modified controller.
If required, reinstall the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade software on the controller.

result.p: The updated controllers are now in service. The controller that was formerly active is now the standby controller.
